articles.title: Amazon to pay more than $580 million to settle tax probe in Italy
articles.content: Amazon has agreed with Italy's tax collection agency to pay 510 million euros ($582 million) ​to settle a tax dispute, two sources close to the ‌matter said on Wednesday, in one of a number of cases involving the company ‌in Italy. However, in an unusual development, Milan's prosecutors are in disagreement with the accord between the revenue agency and the U.S. tech company and plan to continue their criminal investigation, two other sources said. Amazon confirmed ⁠the settlement, but did not ‌specify how much it would pay and criticised the Italian regulatory environment.

articles.title: Amazon pays Italy 180 million euros to end tax, labour probe, sources say
articles.content: An Italian unit of e-commerce giant Amazon has paid compensation and scrapped a ​monitoring system for delivery staff, ending a probe into ‌alleged tax fraud and illegal labour practices, sources with knowledge of the ‌matter said on Friday. In July 2024 the group's logistics services unit was accused of circumventing labour and tax laws, relying on cooperatives or limited liability companies that supplied it with ⁠workers, avoiding VAT tax ‌and reducing social security payments. We have clarified our position with the relevant authorities, who have recognized the high standards of our collaboration model with delivery partners, ⁠Amazon said in a statement.

articles.title: ChatGPT Thinks Amazon Stock Price Will Close At This Level By The End of 2025
articles.content: Shares of Amazon are moving into December with steady business momentum but a choppy tape. The underlying story is intact, but the market is testing how much of the stock's recovery is already reflected in the price. The tone has shifted from a smooth ...

articles.title: As Amazon Launches the Trainium 3 Chip, Should You Buy, Sell, or Hold AMZN Stock?
articles.content: Amazon just rolled out its Trainium3 chip, and the stock jumped. Should investors buy into the excitement, or is it a moment to stay cautious?

articles.title: Amazon vs. Alphabet vs. Meta: This analyst's top AI pick
articles.content: RBC Capital Markets Equity Analyst Brad Erickson comes on Market Catalysts to discuss whether Alphabet's Google (GOOG, GOOGL) may have an advantage in the AI race through its TPU chips (Tensor Processing Units), Amazon's (AMZN) newly announced AI chips, and which tech stock he prefers when choosing between Alphabet, Amazon, and Meta Platforms (META). Also catch Brad Erickson weigh in on reports that Meta will be reducing its Metaverse budget. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

articles.title: Amazon slashes seller fees in bid to compete with Shein, Temu
articles.content: Amazon is set to cut seller fees in Europe by 2% to 5%, suggesting it is exploring ways to compete with ultrafast-fashion e-tailers such as Shein and Temu.

articles.title: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN): A Bull Case Theory
articles.content: We came across a bullish thesis on Amazon.com, Inc. on Capitalist Letter’s Substack by Oguz Erkan. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on AMZN. Amazon.com, Inc.’s share was trading at $233.88 as of December 1st. AMZN’s trailing and forward P/E were 33.03 and 29.59 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. Amazon has doubled its operating cash […]
